VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Public Schools?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Public Schools is {International Schools}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Public Schools?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Public Schools is {Vocational Schools}.

VPR.Q: Which student has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The student with the largest proportion is {Universities}.

VPR.Q: Which student has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The student with the smallest proportion is {Public Schools}.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Vocational Schools slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Vocational Schools slice is {13}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the International Schools slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the International Schools slice is {23}%.

VE.Q: What is the value of the Public Schools slice in this pie chart?
VE.A: The value of the Public Schools slice is {11}%.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in this pie chart?
What is the minimum value in this pie chart?

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Charter Schools and International Schools in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Charter Schools and International Schools is {7}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Online Schools and Universities in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Online Schools and Universities is {37}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 21.25%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.
NF.A: {Universities} accounts for {25}% and {International Schools} accounts for {23}%

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart are below 12.25%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.
NF.A: {Online Schools} accounts for {12}% and {Public Schools} accounts for {11}%

NC.Q: Which is smaller, the value of International Schools, Charter Schools, or Vocational Schools?
NC.A: The value of {Vocational Schools} is smaller.

NC.Q: Which has the largest value: Universities, International Schools, Charter Schools, or Online Schools?
NC.A: The value of {Universities} is the largest.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 10% and 20%?
MSR.A: There are {4} sectors that have a percentage between 10% and 20%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 45%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Charter Schools, Vocational Schools, Online Schools), (Charter Schools, Vocational Schools, Public Schools), (Charter Schools, Online Schools, Public Schools), (Vocational Schools, Online Schools, Public Schools)}.
